resources.string: \u00A71. GENERAL INFORMATION AND TERMS

The •list app creates structured lists. The structure of lists is similar to the file structure of a computer. Units of information are lines and folders.
 	Lines collected in a folder form a list. In addition to lines, folders can be nested in the folder, having the same structure (list in list) and so on. The number of nesting levels is unlimited.
 	Terms:
 Record – general name for lines and folders.
 Root folder – folder that includes all other entries of the •list app, denoted in the app as "R:" (from root directory).
 Child folder/line – folder/line nested in the current folder.
 Parent folder – folder in which the current folder/line is nested.
Main field
\u00A72. RECORDS
\u0009Each record has two layers – foreground and background.
\u0009On the foreground there is:
Checkbox. In it, you can put \u2713 for the completion of this item
To visually distinguish a folder from a line, one of the icons appears under the checkbox for the folder:
empty folder
non-empty folder
\u2713 are set in all entries of this folder

Under the checkbox is the date/time field of the last modification of the entry. If changes were made today, this field displays the time of change, if earlier – the date.
 	Main field – the content of the item is entered into this field. This field must be filled. If left empty, the entry will not be saved
 	1 - note field. Here you can enter any additional text information – “1.5 kg“, “5 pairs“, “100“, “2x50$“ etc. or leave the field empty
 	In empty fields, blue inscriptions appear - this is hint text. Do not confuse with the default value!
 ATTENTION! •list allows the presence of two or more entries with the same content in one folder.

 	Bell indicator. Appears if a reminder is set for the entry:
Reminder is set for tomorrow or a later date
Reminder is set for today
Reminder time has expired
By touching this indicator, you can find out the date and time of the set reminder.
Drag controller. By touching it, you can drag the record up or down the list
\u0009On the background there are buttons. To access them, swipe the record.\n \u0009When swiping to the right, the button opens:
delete the record. If it\'s a folder, it will be deleted along with all nested entries.
\u0009When swiping left, up to three buttons open, depending on the content of the entry:\n \u0009for all records
setting a reminder
or, if a reminder for this entry is already set
editing the reminder
converting a line to a folder
converting a folder to a line (if this folder is empty)
editing the record
\u0009If you want to highlight any entry (for example, as the most important), press and hold it for ~1 second. A context menu will appear on the screen.

\u0009Use this menu to select the color and/or font style and/or underline for this entry. The right button “T“ resets the font settings.\n \u0009If you need to set/reset font parameters for all entries in the current folder, press and hold the corresponding context menu button for ~1 second.
\u00A73. LINES

\u0009To create a new line, click on “New Line“ at the bottom of the list. To make changes to the text of an existing line, click on it. The line will enter edit mode and the keyboard will appear on the screen. Editing occurs directly in the line. Enter the desired text and press the “OK“ button on the keyboard, the program will proceed to the note field, enter the desired text or leave this field empty and press “OK“. Editing an existing line ends here. If you were editing a new line, the program will create the next new line and proceed to its editing, allowing you to easily record several new items in the list in a row. If you want to complete the process of creating new lines, leave the main field empty and press the “OK“ button.\n \u0020\u0020\u0020ATTENTION! On some devices, the “OK“ button may have a different label – “Done“, “Enter“, “\u2713“ etc.
\u00A74. FOLDERS

In terms of content, a folder does not differ from a line. There is only one functional difference – clicking on a folder opens its contents. Visually, you can distinguish a folder from a line by the icon to the left of the main record field.
 	Any line can be converted to a folder. Swipe the line to the left, then on the background, press the button to convert the line to a folder.
 	To create a new folder, first create a line with the desired content, and then convert it to a folder.
 	It is possible to convert a folder back to a line, provided that this folder is empty. To do this, swipe this record to the left, then on the background, press the button to convert the folder to a line.
\u00A75. NAVIGATION

\u0009After loading, \u2022list opens the root folder. You can navigate to any child folder by clicking on it. Within an open folder, you can also click on any child folder to open it, and so on. To return to the parent folder, press the "Back" button ("\u003C") in the system toolbar at the bottom of the screen (for older devices, at the bottom of the case).\n \u0009In the lower right corner of the screen, there is a small floating panel
\u0009There is only one button on this panel
button to go to the root folder
\u0009next is statistics
number of lines in the current folder
number of nested folders in the current folder
total number of records in the current folder
\u00A76. CHANGING FONT SIZE

\u0009Scroll the list. In its lower part, there is empty space (without lines). In this area, using ZOOM, you can change the font size of the main fields.\n \u0009The font size can also be set in the application settings.
\u00A77. REMINDERS

\u0009You can set a reminder for each entry. At the date/time you specify, the app will remind you by issuing a notification. Clicking on the notification opens the required list.\n \u0009To set or edit a reminder, swipe the entry to the left and press the bell button. A special window will open where you need to set the date and time of the reminder, as well as enter the reminder text (by default, this is the text from the main record field).
Name of the current folder
\u00A78. TOP TOOLBAR
\u0009The top toolbar of the application is located at the top of the screen.
\u0009The panel contains:
button to open the application\'s Main menu. From it, you can go to the description and settings of the application, familiarize yourself with the privacy policy, write to the developer
\u0009In the center of the panel, there is a field displaying the name of the current folder. If you need to know the full path to the folder, click on this field.
\u00A79. SIDE TOOLBAR
\u0009On the right edge of the screen, there is a red flag of the sliding toolbar. Swipe left on it. The side toolbar will appear on the screen.\n \u0009The panel has a row of buttons:
"Expand" button. The side toolbar can be expanded – the buttons will have labels explaining their purpose
enables NO SLEEP mode

\u0009If this mode is off, after the set time, the device will go into sleep mode. Sometimes it is useful (for example, when packing a suitcase according to a list) to disable sleep mode. This button is for that purpose.\n \u0009This mode is not optimal in terms of battery consumption. Therefore, it only works in the current folder. If you leave the folder, it will turn off automatically. Animation will remind you that this uneconomical mode is enabled.
send list. See \u00A7 15
convert text to list. See \u00A7 14
remove \u2713, remove \u2713 in all records of the current folder
move/copy records mode. See \u00A7 10
delete mode. See \u00A7 11
restore recently deleted records mode. See \u00A7 12
archive mode. See \u00A7 13
\u00A710. INFORMATION TRANSFER MODE
\u0009Information transfer mode is activated by this button on the side toolbar

\u0009The app has its own clipboard, into which the records you specify are placed and from which they are then unloaded into the folder you specify (this folder must exist before enabling transfer mode).\n \u0009In transfer mode, the program blocks any changes inside the folder (editing, dragging, and creating a new record), access to buttons on the background is blocked, but navigation through folders is preserved, allowing you to put records from any folder in the program\'s clipboard.\n \u0009A toolbar appears at the bottom of the screen
\u0009In this mode, the record drag controller is replaced by a button, clicking which opens a context menu

The “Cut“ button means that after copying, the record will be deleted from the source folder (transferring the record).
 	The “Copy“ button - after copying, the record remains in the source folder (copying the record).
 	The “Cancel“ button removes the record from the clipboard.
 	If you need to put/remove all lines of the current folder into/from the buffer, press and hold the corresponding context menu button for ~1 second.

\u0009After pressing the “Cut“ or “Copy“ button, the record is marked with the corresponding icon.\n \u0009In the top right corner of the “Paste“ button on the bottom toolbar, the number of records in the clipboard is shown in a red circle.\n \u0009After you have placed all the necessary records in the clipboard, open the folder where you want to place these records and press the “Paste” button on the bottom panel. The program will perform the necessary data processing, close the transfer mode, and clear the buffer.

\u0009The “\u2715” button on the bottom panel turns off transfer mode and clears the buffer.\n \u0009ATTENTION! Folders placed in the clipboard are copied or transferred along with all their contents.\n \u0009ATTENTION! You cannot paste a folder into itself or into its child folder - this will lead to recursion or circular reference.

\u0009When copying a folder into itself or its child folder, an exact copy of the source folder is created. Since the source folder now contains a copy of itself, the copy of the folder will also have a copy created, and in that copy another copy, etc. – an infinite loop. This situation is called recursion.

\u0009When transferring a folder into itself or its child folder, the folder\'s attachment to the parent folder changes, and now its parent folder will be the destination folder. And since the destination folder is attached to the folder being copied, a circular reference arises: when exiting the destination folder, you enter the folder being copied, and from the folder being copied – to the destination folder, and so on in a circle, you can go infinitely.
\u0009Before pasting, \u2022list performs a check and will warn you in case such a situation occurs.
\u00A711. DELETION MODE

\u0009Deletion mode allows you to delete multiple records of the current folder in one operation. This mode works only in the current folder.\n \u0009In deletion mode, the program blocks any changes inside the folder (editing, dragging, and creating a new record), access to buttons on the substrate is blocked, switching to another folder.
\u0009This button on the side toolbar enables deletion mode
\u0009A toolbar appears at the bottom of the screen
\u0009In this mode, the drag and drop controller is replaced by a button that, when clicked, selects the records to be deleted and marks them with the appropriate icon.

If the record is selected by mistake, click on it again. This action will cancel the previous one.
 	In the upper right corner of the "Delete" button on the bottom toolbar, in a red circle, the number of records marked for deletion is shown.
 	If you want to delete all records of the current folder, press the "Select All" button on the bottom toolbar.
 	After you have selected all the necessary records, press the "Delete" button on the bottom toolbar. The program will perform the necessary data processing and close the deletion mode.
 	ATTENTION! Folders are deleted along with all their contents.
 	The "✕" button on the bottom panel turns off deletion mode.
\u00A712. RECOVERY MODE

\u0009The records you deleted go to the trash. They are stored there for 1-7 days from the moment of deletion (you can set this parameter in the settings). During this time, they can be restored. After the storage period expires, the records are deleted permanently.\n \u0009In recovery mode, the program blocks any changes inside the folder (editing, dragging, and creating a new record), access to buttons on the substrate is blocked, switching to another folder.
\u0009This button on the side toolbar enables recovery mode
\u0009The screen will display the deleted records of the current folder that can be restored.
\u0009In this mode, the drag and drop controller for records is replaced by a button that, when clicked, selects records for recovery and marks them with the appropriate icon.

If the record is selected by mistake, click on it again. This action will cancel the previous one.
 	In the upper right corner of the "Restore" button on the bottom toolbar, in a red circle, the number of records marked for restoration is shown.
 	If you want to restore all records of the current folder, press the "Select All" button on the bottom toolbar.
 	After you have selected all the necessary records, press the "Restore" button on the bottom toolbar. The program will perform the necessary data processing and close the recovery mode.
 	ATTENTION! Folders are restored along with all their contents.
 	The "✕" button on the bottom panel turns off recovery mode.
\u00A713. ARCHIVE MODE

\u0009If any list is currently not needed by you, do not rush to delete it. It may be needed in the future. Send it to the archive.\n \u0009In ARCHIVE mode, the program blocks any changes inside the folder (editing, dragging, and creating a new record), access to buttons on the substrate is blocked, but navigation through folders is preserved.
\u0009This button on the side toolbar enables ARCHIVE mode
\u0009In this mode, the record drag controller (folders) is replaced by a button:
this folder is archived
this folder is not archived
\u0009You can change the folder\'s status by pressing this button.\n \u0009The "\u2715" button on the bottom panel turns off ARCHIVE mode.
\u00A714. TEXT TO LIST CONVERSION
\u0009This button on the side toolbar enables conversion mode

•list adds lines obtained from text to the current list. Therefore, first open the desired list, then press this button. The "Conversion" window will open.
 	In the center of the "Conversion" window there is a large text field. You can enter or paste the text you want to convert into a list.
 	 •list can convert any text into a list. But for the result to please you, the text should resemble a list.
 	The text should be broken into lines. The line separator is the invisible newline character, which is inserted into the text by pressing the "↲" keyboard button.
 	ATTENTION! On some devices, this button may have a different label – "Enter" etc.
 	At the beginning of the line there may be a serial number (optional). The serial number must be an integer and followed by the symbols ".⎵" (dot+space). If the symbols before ".⎵" can be converted to an integer, •list considers them a serial number and discards them. Further in the line, combinations ".⎵" may repeat, •list will only react to the first one.
 	If you want to place part of the line in the "Note" field, this part should be at the end of the line and separated from the main field by the symbols "⎵-⎵" (space+hyphen+space). The line may contain repeating combinations "⎵-⎵", •list reacts only to the last one.
 	Leading and trailing spaces in lines are discarded.
 	The text may contain empty lines and lines containing only spaces. •list ignores them.
 	After you have prepared the text, press the "Convert" button at the bottom of the window. The program will perform the necessary data processing and close the conversion mode.
\u00A715. SEND THE LIST
\u0009In this mode, the list content is converted to text that you can send using any app capable of sending text installed on your device.
\u0009This button on the side toolbar enables list forwarding mode

\u0009The "Share" window will open. In the center of the window, in a large text field, you will see the converted list. This is the text of the message being sent. You can edit it (add comments, remove unnecessary parts, etc.).\n \u0009After preparing the text, press the "Send" button at the bottom of the window. To send this message, you will be given the opportunity to select any email service or messenger installed on your device.
